byline.contributor: Trip Gabriel reported from Des Moines, and Amy Chozick from New York.
byline.original: By TRIP GABRIEL and AMY CHOZICK

abstract: Sen Bernie Sanders's presidential campaign has established extensive ground game in Iowa, where it hopes to turn out tens of thousands of grass-roots supporters in order to secure victory that will confirm his candidacy as viable; Hillary Clinton's campaign also hopes to prevail in state, for most part to avoid recalling her third place finish in 2008 caucuses, which Barack Obama won.
lead_paragraph: His campaign has assembled an extensive effort for the crucial Feb. 1 caucuses, with 100 paid staff members and volunteer leaders.

headline.main: Bernie Sanders, Needing Early Lift, Builds Iowa Ground Operation
headline.print_headline: Sanders Bets Ground Game on Iowa Upset

snippet: His campaign has assembled an extensive effort for the crucial Feb. 1 caucuses, with 100 paid staff members and volunteer leaders.
